org.jtrim.swing.component

Class BasicTransformationModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.swing.component.BasicTransformationModel

  • public final class BasicTransformationModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a container for basic image transformations and for the zoom to fit transformation. Client code may listen for changes in a BasicTransformationModel by adding listeners. Therefore this class is suited to be used by Swing components.

    Notice that when using the zoom to fit transformation, there are properties which might cannot be fulfilled (such as zoom). In these cases the zoom to fit should take precedence.

    Thread safety

    Methods reading values from this model are safe to access from multiple threads concurrently (even concurrently with writes). Updating the values however may not be done concurrently, even if updating different properties of the same BasicTransformationModel instance.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent. Note therefore that you should avoid organizing access to instances of this class using locks because methods of this class might invoke listeners (and you should have little expectations on what listeners do). The best way to use this class in a multi-thread environment is to use it from a dedicated thread, or from a TaskExecutor which does not execute tasks concurrently. You may also use the TaskExecutors.inOrderExecutor(TaskExecutor) method to create such an executor.

    Note however, that this class was designed for Swing components and if you are using this with one, you should only use this class on the AWT Event Dispatch Thread.

    See Also:
    BasicImageTransformations, BasicTransformationProperty

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicTransformationModel()
      Creates a new BasicTransformationModel with the identity transformation and with zoom to fit being disabled (i.e., the isInZoomToFitMode() method returns false initially).

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicTransformationModel

        public BasicTransformationModel()
        Creates a new BasicTransformationModel with the identity transformation and with zoom to fit being disabled (i.e., the isInZoomToFitMode() method returns false initially).

    • Method Detail

      • addChangeListener

        public org.jtrim.event.ListenerRef addChangeListener(java.lang.Runnable listener)
        Adds listener which will be notified whenever any of the properties of this BasicTransformationModel changes. This is equivalent to adding a transformation listener and notifying the listener in every methods of the listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the Runnable whose run method is to be called when any of the properties changes. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the reference which can be used to remove the currently added listener. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified listener is null
        See Also:
        addTransformationListener(TransformationListener)

      • addTransformationListener

        public org.jtrim.event.ListenerRef addTransformationListener(TransformationListener listener)
        Adds a listener whose appropriate method will be called when a property of this BasicTransformationModel changes.

        If you want to execute the same code for every property changes, consider using the addChangeListener method instead.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener whose appropriate method will be called when a property changes. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the reference which can be used to remove the currently added listener. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified listener is null
        See Also:
        addChangeListener(Runnable)

      • getTransformations

        public BasicImageTransformations getTransformations()
        Returns the snapshot of the transformations currently set transformations. The return value does not include to currently set zoom to fit mode.
        Returns:
        the snapshot of the transformations currently set transformations. This method never returns null.

      • setFlip

        public void setFlip(boolean flipHorizontal,
           boolean flipVertical)
        Sets if the image should be flipped horizontally or vertically.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        flipHorizontal - if true the image should be flipped horizontally, so that the left side of the image becomes the right side of the image, otherwise set it to false
        flipVertical - if true the image should be flipped vertically, so that the top side of the image becomes the bottom side of the image, otherwise set it to false
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • isFlipHorizontal

        public boolean isFlipHorizontal()
        Returns true if the image needs to be flipped horizontally. That is, the left side of the image need to be the right side of the image.
        Returns:
        true if the image needs to be flipped horizontally, false otherwise

      • setFlipHorizontal

        public void setFlipHorizontal(boolean flipHorizontal)
        Sets if the image should be flipped horizontally. That is, if the left side of the image should become the right side of the image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        flipHorizontal - if true the image should be flipped horizontally, set it to false otherwise
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • flipHorizontal

        public void flipHorizontal()
        Inverts the "FlipHorizontal" property. Calling this method is effectively equivalent to calling: setFlipHorizontal(!isFlipHorizontal()).

        This method will notify the appropriate listeners.

        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • isFlipVertical

        public boolean isFlipVertical()
        Returns true if the image needs to be flipped vertically. That is, the top side of the image need to be the bottom side of the image.
        Returns:
        true if the image needs to be flipped vertically, false otherwise

      • setFlipVertical

        public void setFlipVertical(boolean flipVertical)
        Sets if the image should be flipped vertically. That is, if the top side of the image should become the bottom side of the image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        flipVertical - if true the image should be flipped vertically, set it to false otherwise
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • flipVertical

        public void flipVertical()
        Inverts the "FlipVertical" property. Calling this method is effectively equivalent to calling: setFlipVertical(!isFlipVertical()).

        This method will notify the appropriate listeners.

        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • getOffsetX

        public double getOffsetX()
        Returns the offset along the horizontal axis. Note that the offset is to be applied after zoom has been applied.
        Returns:
        the offset along the horizontal axis

      • getOffsetY

        public double getOffsetY()
        Returns the offset along the vertical axis. Note that the offset is to be applied after zoom has been applied.
        Returns:
        the offset along the vertical axis

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset(double offsetX,
             double offsetY)
        Sets both the horizontal an vertical offset need to be applied on the image.

        Note that these offsets are to be applied after zoom has been applied.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        offsetX - the offset along the horizontal axis. Subsequent getOffsetX() method calls will return this value.
        offsetY - the offset along the vertical axis. Subsequent getOffsetY() method calls will return this value.

      • getRotateInRadians

        public double getRotateInRadians()
        Returns the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.
        Returns:
        the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. This method returns always returns a normalized angle. That is, a value between 0 and 2*pi or NaN if NaN was set.

      • setRotateInRadians

        public void setRotateInRadians(double radians)
        Sets the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.

        Note: Settings this property also changes the value returned by the getRotateInDegrees() method.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        radians - the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. Note that this property is stored in a normalized form. So this property will be set to value between 0 and 2*pi or NaN.

      • getRotateInDegrees

        public int getRotateInDegrees()
        Returns the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.

        Notice that this property is an int, if you need better precision, use the getRotateInRadians() method.

        If the rotation amount was set by the setRotateInRadians method, this method will round the value to the closest integer (after converting radians to degrees).

        Returns:
        the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. This method returns always returns a normalized angle. That is, a value which is greater than or equal to zero and less than (not equal) to 360.

      • setRotateInDegrees

        public void setRotateInDegrees(int degrees)
        Sets the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.

        Notice that this property is an int, if you need better precision, use the setRotateInRadians method.

        Note: Settings this property also changes the value returned by the getRotateInRadians() method.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        degrees - the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. Note that this property is stored in a normalized form. So this property will be set to value which is greater than or equal to zero and less than (not equal) to 360.

      • getZoomX

        public double getZoomX()
        Returns the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally. For example: If this method returns 2.0, the image must be scaled to an image which has twice the width of the original image. Respectively, a value of 0.5 means that the resulting image must be scaled to an image which has half the width of the original image.

        This method may return a negative value which should be interpreted as flipping the image horizontally and scaling with the absolute value.

        The client code should also expect that this property might be zero, NaN or even infinity. How these special values are handled are left to the client code.

        Returns:
        the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(double zoomX,
           double zoomY)
        Sets the scaling factors used to scale the image horizontally and vertically. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoomX adjusts the width and zoomY adjusts the height of the original image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        zoomX - the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally
        zoomY - the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically

      • setZoomX

        public void setZoomX(double zoomX)
        Sets the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoomX adjusts the width of the original image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        zoomX - the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally

      • getZoomY

        public double getZoomY()
        Returns the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically. For example: If this method returns 2.0, the image must be scaled to an image which has twice the height of the original image. Respectively, a value of 0.5 means that the resulting image must be scaled to an image which has half the height of the original image.

        This method may return a negative value which should be interpreted as flipping the image vertically and scaling with the absolute value.

        The client code should also expect that this property might be zero, NaN or even infinity. How these special values are handled are left to the client code.

        Returns:
        the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically

      • setZoomY

        public void setZoomY(double zoomY)
        Sets the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoomY adjusts the height of the original image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        zoomY - the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(double zoom)
        Sets the scaling factors used to scale the image horizontally and vertically to the same value. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoom adjusts both the width and the height of the original image.

        This method is effectively equivalent to calling: setZoom(zoom, zoom).

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        zoom - the scaling factor used to scale the image both horizontally and vertically

      • isInZoomToFitMode

        public boolean isInZoomToFitMode()
        Returns true if the image should scaled to fit the display in which it is displayed. That is, this method returns the same value as the following expression: getZoomToFitOptions() != null.

        If the zoom to fit requirement conflicts with any of the properties stored in this BasicTransformationMode, the zoom to fit mode should take precedence.

        Returns:
        true if the image should scaled to fit the display in which it is displayed, false if it should be displayed according to the other properties of this BasicTransformationMode

      • getZoomToFitOptions

        public java.util.Set<ZoomToFitOption> getZoomToFitOptions()
        Returns the set of rules which should be used when displaying the image in zoom to fit mode or null if other properties of this BasicTransformationMode should be used instead.
        Returns:
        the set of rules which should be used when displaying the image in zoom to fit mode or null if other properties of this BasicTransformationMode should be used instead

      • clearZoomToFit

        public void clearZoomToFit()
        Causes subsequent getZoomToFitOptions() method calls to return null.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

      • setZoomToFit

        public void setZoomToFit(boolean keepAspectRatio,
                boolean magnify)
        Sets the zoom to fit mode with the following rules: ZoomToFitOption.FIT_HEIGHT, ZoomToFitOption.FIT_WIDTH and with the ones specified in the arguments.

        This method call is equivalent to calling: setZoomToFit(keepAspectRatio, magnify, true, true).

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        keepAspectRatio - if true the zoom to fit mode will also include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO
        magnify - if true the zoom to fit mode will also include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.MAY_MAGNIFY

      • setZoomToFit

        public void setZoomToFit(boolean keepAspectRatio,
                boolean magnify,
                boolean fitWidth,
                boolean fitHeight)
        Sets the zoom to fit mode with the specified rules.

        Subsequent getZoomToFitOptions() method calls will return these set of rules.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        keepAspectRatio - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO
        magnify - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.MAY_MAGNIFY
        fitWidth - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.FIT_WIDTH
        fitHeight - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.FIT_HEIGHT

      • setZoomToFit

        public void setZoomToFit(java.util.Set<ZoomToFitOption> zoomToFitOptions)
        Sets the zoom to fit mode with the specified rules.

        Subsequent getZoomToFitOptions() method calls will return these set of rules.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        zoomToFitOptions - the zoom to fit options to be returned by subsequent getZoomToFitOptions() method calls. The content of this set will be copied and this method will not store a reference to it. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument is null

      • setTransformations

        public void setTransformations(BasicImageTransformations newTransformations)
        Sets all the transformation properties of this BasicTransformationModel from the specified BasicImageTransformations.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners. Note that this method does not necessarily invoke the listeners only after all properties have been set. That is, the effect of this method cannot be considered atomic in any way.

        Parameters:
        newTransformations - the BasicImageTransformations from which the properties are to be extracted. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument is null
